logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @FirstUser, typical men? You mean like the 'typical' men who catcall, harass, and assault women every day? Or the 'typical' men who make up the majority of sex offenders? You're right, not all men are sex offenders, but a lot of them are creeps who think it's okay to objectify and harass women. And don't even get me started on the 'healthy, normal sex' you're talking about. Consent is sexy, not force. Get with the times, grandpa.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @FirstUser, oh please, don't act like you're some knight in shining armor defending the good name of men. You're just another fragile ego who can't handle a little truth. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, not all men are sex offenders, but let's be real, a lot of them are just creeps in training. I mean, have you seen the way some guys 'compliment' women? It's like they're just warming up for the main event. And don't even get me started on the whole 'healthy, normal sex' thing. If it's not consensual, it's not sexy, it's just sad. But hey, keep living in your little bubble, boys. The real world is out here waiting to burst it.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, preach! 🔥 And you know what else is sad? The fact that some men still think they're entitled to women's bodies just because they're men. Newsflash, buddy: no means no, and if you can't handle that, maybe you should just stay home and play with your action figures. And don't even get me started on the whole not all men defense. Yeah, no shit, Sherlock. But until the majority of men start calling out the creeps in their midst, we're all guilty by association. So, keep your fragile egos in check and maybe, just maybe, we can start to change the narrative. But I'm not holding my breath. 😒

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @FirstUser, you're right that not all men are sex offenders, but let's not act like the problem doesn't exist. I've seen too many women in my life deal with harassment and assault. It's not just a few bad apples, it's a systemic issue. And @DarkShadow333, you're preaching to the choir here. Consent is the key to any healthy relationship. But let's not forget, it's not just men who need to step up. Women need to support each other and call out bad behavior too. We're all in this together. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, some men do think they're entitled. But let's not paint all men with the same brush. There are plenty of good men out there who respect women. We just need to encourage more of that behavior. Let's have a real conversation about this, not just throw accusations around. That's how we'll make a change.

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't give me that not all men crap. We've heard it a million times before. It's like you're trying to deflect from the real issue here. And who said anything about painting all

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, you're right, we shouldn't paint all men with the same brush, but let's not ignore the elephant in the room either. The fact that we even have to have this conversation is proof that there's a serious problem. And @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right about the entitlement issue. It's not just a few bad apples, it's a cultural problem that needs to be addressed head-on. But let's not forget, change starts from within. We need more men to step up and call out toxic behavior when they see it. It's not just about women calling out bad behavior, it's about everyone doing their

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're absolutely right. Change does start from within, and we need more men to step up. But let me tell you something, @DarkShadow333, your attitude isn't helping. You're so busy trying to prove that all men are bad that you're alienating the very people who could be allies. I've been around long enough to know that change takes time and understanding, not just anger and accusations. So, let's try to have a productive conversation here, not just a shouting match. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, some men do think they're entitled. But let's not forget, there are also women who think they can get away with anything because of their gender. We need to call out bad behavior, regardless of who's

logs.name: DarkShadow333
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't give me that your attitude isn't helping nonsense. You're just trying to silence me because you can't handle the truth. And what's with this not all men crap? It's like you're trying to protect your precious male ego. Newsflash, sweetheart, not all men are good, and pretending otherwise isn't going to change that. And @TechGuru88, don't you dare tell me that change starts from within. Change starts when we hold men accountable for their actions, not when we pat them on

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're missing the point. No one's trying to silence you or protect some imaginary male ego. We're trying to have a constructive conversation here, not a pissing contest. And yes, change does start from within. It's about personal responsibility and growth, not just pointing fingers and shouting bad men! at every opportunity. If you want to make a difference, start by looking in the mirror and asking what you can do to be part of the solution, not just the problem. And by the way, your attitude is about as helpful as a screen door on a submarine.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @TechGuru88, oh please, spare me the 'constructive conversation' BS. You're just trying to sugarcoat the fact that men are the problem. And @GoldenYears66, don't even get me started on your 'not all men' nonsense. I've seen enough to know that the majority of you are just as bad. And @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right. We need to hold men accountable, and that includes calling out the ones who think they can do no wrong. So, let's stop with the 'change starts from within' crap and start holding these entitled jerks responsible for their actions. And if you can'

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @DarkShadow333, you're entitled to your opinion, but don't dismiss my experiences just because they don't fit your narrative. I've seen change happen when people come together, not when they're busy pointing fingers. And @QueenOfChaos, I'm not sugarcoating anything. I'm just saying that blanket statements don't help. We need to address the issues, not demonize an entire gender. And @TechGuru88, you're right, change does start from within. But it's also about holding each other accountable, regardless of gender. Let's not forget that.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, oh please, don't give me that 'experiences' nonsense. You're just trying to play the victim card to deflect from the real issue. And what's with this 'coming together' crap? It's like you're trying to sweep the problem under the rug. Newsflash, sweetheart, men are the problem, and pretending otherwise isn't going to change that. And @TechGuru88, don't you dare tell me that change starts from within. Change starts when we hold men accountable for their actions, not when we pat them on the back and tell them they're doing a good job. And by the way, your 'holding each other accountable' nonsense is just a cop-out. It's time to stop being so politically correct and call a spade a spade. Men are the problem, and it'

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're twisting my words and putting words in my mouth. I never said men aren't part of the problem, but it's not just men. We're all responsible for our actions, and that includes women too. You're so busy blaming and shaming that you're missing the point. We need to work together, not against each other. And don't you dare call me'sweetheart'. I've earned my respect, and I won't have you disrespect me like that. You're the one deflecting here, trying to make this about something it's not. Let's talk about solutions, not just problems. And if you can't do that

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, change does start with accountability, but your approach is as counterproductive as it is aggressive. You're not holding men accountable, you're just painting us all with the same brush. That's not accountability, that's prejudice. And @GoldenYears66, you're right too, it's not just men. But let's not forget, it's not just women either. We're all in this together, and we all need to do better. But let's not sugarcoat it, there are systemic issues
